name: malignly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes or intends to cause harm or evil: As she walked back across the yard he stared at her malignly. She smiled, a little malignly.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are wonderful people, but they have been malignly stereotyped in this country for centuries.He has also suggested that the law could be used malignly.Our libel laws can sometimes be used malignly in an attempt to silence the critics of powerful people.
